suggestions.original: To improve the line combinations in the artwork, consider refining the transitions between different sections. For instance, the lines separating the figures from the background could be more defined to enhance clarity. Additionally, integrating more consistent line thickness and style throughout the piece can create a more cohesive look. Paying attention to the direction and flow of lines, especially in the background, can also help in guiding the viewer's eye and enhancing the overall visual narrative.
suggestions.current: To improve the line combinations in the artwork, simplifying the transitions between sections might give the composition a cleaner and more modern feel. Instead of making the separating lines more defined, try softening the lines between the figures and the background to create a smoother blend. Reducing line thickness variation across the piece will provide a more unified appearance.
suggestions.added: softening the lines between the figures and the background to create a smoother blend. Reducing line thickness variation across the piece will provide a more unified appearance.
suggestions.removed: the lines separating the figures from the background could be more defined to enhance clarity. Additionally, integrating more consistent line thickness and style throughout the piece can create a more cohesive look.

suggestions.original: The line combinations are effective, but adding finer, more intricate lines in the background could create more texture and depth. This would add complexity and make the artwork more engaging. Varying the line styles in different areas can also create interesting contrasts and help separate the elements more clearly.
suggestions.current: Instead of adding intricate lines, consider keeping the background lines simple and minimal to maintain focus on the figures. By reducing line detail in the background, the viewer's attention will be drawn to the key elements without distraction. Consistent line styles across the piece can create a balanced and harmonious composition.
suggestions.added: By reducing line detail in the background, the viewer's attention will be drawn to the key elements without distraction. Consistent line styles across the piece can create a balanced and harmonious composition.
suggestions.removed: adding finer, more intricate lines in the background could create more texture and depth. This would add complexity and make the artwork more engaging. Varying the line styles in different areas can also create interesting contrasts and help separate the elements more clearly.

suggestions.original: To add more movement and dynamism, consider experimenting with curved and flowing lines in areas like the background or the figures' clothing. This could inject more energy into the composition and make the piece feel more dynamic. Using a mix of straight and curved lines can also create visual contrast and keep the viewer's eye engaged.
suggestions.current: To create a more orderly and serene composition, try focusing on straight, clean lines throughout the artwork. Keeping the lines consistent and linear across both the background and figures will give the piece a more structured and balanced feel. Avoiding too many curved or flowing lines can reduce visual noise and make the overall composition more refined.
suggestions.added: Keeping the lines consistent and linear across both the background and figures will give the piece a more structured and balanced feel. Avoiding too many curved or flowing lines can reduce visual noise and make the overall composition more refined.
suggestions.removed: experimenting with curved and flowing lines in areas like the background or the figures' clothing. This could inject more energy into the composition and make the piece feel more dynamic. Using a mix of straight and curved lines can also create visual contrast and keep the viewer's eye engaged.
